# Dot function

As we have mentioned above, not all functions are pipe-friendly. While `%>>%` accepts `{}` and `()` on the right side, `Pipe` object provides `.()` to perform exactly the same set of features with `x %>>% (...)`.

## Pipe to dot

```{r}
Pipe(mtcars)$
  .(lm(mpg ~ cyl + wt, data = .))
```

## Pipe by formula

```{r}
Pipe(mtcars)$
  .(df ~ lm(mpg ~ cyl + wt, data = df))
```
